tables.table_schema:
CREATE TABLE resource_metrics ( 
    server_id UUID, 
    cpu_utilization DECIMAL, 
    memory_utilization DECIMAL, 
    storage_utilization DECIMAL, 
    network_utilization DECIMAL, 
    timestamp TIMESTAMP 
)

CREATE TABLE performance_metrics ( 
    server_id UUID, 
    cpu_usage DECIMAL, 
    memory_usage DECIMAL, 
    storage_usage DECIMAL, 
    network_throughput DECIMAL, 
    timestamp TIMESTAMP 
)

CREATE TABLE resource_utilization (
    id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
    resource_name VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
    resource_type VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
    utilization_metric DECIMAL NOT NULL,
    timestamp TIMESTAMPTZ NOT NULL
);

CREATE TABLE cloud_infrastructure (
    id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
    server_name VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
    server_ip VARCHAR(15) NOT NULL,
    hardware_type VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
    location VARCHAR(100) NOT NULL
);

CREATE TABLE resource_utilization (
    id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    resource_name VARCHAR(255),
    resource_type VARCHAR(50),
    usage_metric DECIMAL,
    timestamp TIMESTAMP
);

CREATE TABLE resource_performance (
    id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    resource_id INT,
    performance_metric DECIMAL,
    performance_date DATE,
    FOREIGN KEY (resource_id) REFERENCES resource_utilization(id)
);

CREATE TABLE cloud_instances (
    instance_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    instance_type VARCHAR(50),
    instance_status VARCHAR(20),
    region VARCHAR(50),
    launch_date DATE
);

CREATE TABLE alerts (
    alert_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    resource_id INT,
    alert_message TEXT,
    alert_date TIMESTAMP,
    FOREIGN KEY (resource_id) REFERENCES resource_utilization(id)
);
